title: 104_hr2715
content: The "Paperwork Elimination Act of 1996" aims to reduce the burden of federal paperwork on various entities by promoting the use of electronic information technologies. It also seeks to enhance the effectiveness of federal agencies in complying with the Paperwork Reduction Act. The amendment to Section 3504 of title 44, United States Code, promotes the use of electronic information technology, including electronic submission, maintenance, or disclosure of information as an alternative to paper. The amendment to Section 3504 of title 44, United States Code encourages the use of electronic information technology as an alternative to paper. SEC. 4 amends Section 3505(a)(3) of title 44, US Code to include progress in electronic submission, maintenance, or disclosure of information to reduce burden on small businesses. Section 3506(c)(1)(B) and Section 3506(c)(3)(C) of title 44, United States Code, are amended to allow for optional electronic maintenance, submission, or disclosure of information, promoting the use of electronic information management. The amendment to Section 3506(c)(3)(J) of title 44, United States Code, promotes the use of alternative information technologies for electronic maintenance, submission, or disclosure of information to improve data quality and agency efficiency. SEC. 6 amends Section 3507(a)(1)(D)(ii) of title 44, United States Code, to include a description of how respondents can electronically maintain, submit, or disclose information. SEC. 7 focuses on responsiveness to Congress. SEC. 7 amends Section 3514(a)(2) of title 44, United States Code, to reduce information burden on small businesses through electronic submission. SEC. 8 states the effective date of the Act as October 1, 1997. The Act was passed by the House of Representatives on April 24, 1996.
